title: A tutorial on the Bayesian statistical approach to inverse problems. (arXiv:2304.07610v1 [stat.ME])
abstract: Inverse problems are ubiquitous in the sciences and engineering. Two categories of inverse problems concerning a physical system are (1) estimate parameters in a model of the system from observed input-output pairs and (2) given a model of the system, reconstruct the input to it that caused some observed output. Applied inverse problems are challenging because a solution may (i) not exist, (ii) not be unique, or (iii) be sensitive to measurement noise contaminating the data. tldr: 本文介绍了贝叶斯统计方法在逆问题中的应用，通过热传递模型的实例例子，阐释了BSI的能力，优点，并指出实现BSI的重要步骤和注意事项。
en_tdlr: This tutorial paper provides an introduction to the application of Bayesian statistical inversion (BSI) in inverse problems. The advantages of BSI over traditional methods include quantifying uncertainty by assigning a probability to each possible value of the unknown parameter/input and incorporating prior information and beliefs about the parameter/input. The tutorial uses illustrative examples of heat transfer to explain the capabilities and important steps of implementing BSI.
